tasks.title: Customised Keycloak Theme on Signup Page
tasks.description:
User Story: Customised Keycloak Theme for CSR and CHRO

Title: View Customised Keycloak Theme Based on Product Selection

As a user of the Keycloak authentication system,  
I want to view a customised theme based on the product I select (CSR [Socio-XN] or CHRO[Engage-XN | iGiv-XN]),  
So that I can have a tailored experience that reflects the branding and functionality specific to the product I am using.

Design for CSR: https://xd.adobe.com/view/e64f656c-5901-43d6-96a7-53492e90cf5f-b31c/
Design for CHRO: https://xd.adobe.com/view/e64f656c-5901-43d6-96a7-53492e90cf5f-b31c/screen/a51fbad6-7a18-4de8-887f-cf9dc55a1102

Acceptance Criteria:

1. Product Selection:
   - The user must be able to select between two products: CSR (Customer Service Representative) and CHRO (Chief Human Resources Officer). i.e upon clicking on different sign up page 
   - Upon selection, the system should dynamically update the theme to reflect the chosen product.

2. Customised Themes:
   - The CSR theme should include branding elements such as colours, logos, and fonts specific to customer service.
   - The CHRO theme should feature branding elements that resonate with human resources, including relevant imagery and typography.

3. Development of Themes:
   - The development team must create distinct themes for CSR and CHRO within Keycloak.
   - Each theme should be tested for responsiveness and compatibility across different devices and browsers.

4. User Experience:
   - The transition between themes should be seamless, with no noticeable lag or disruption in the user experience.
 

This user story aims to enhance user satisfaction by providing a personalised experience that aligns with their specific product needs while ensuring a smooth and efficient authentication process.

tasks.title: User Story 7.4: Email Template to Corporate When MA Approves or rejects  Product Upgrade Requests
tasks.description:
As a system, I need to send an email notification to the corporate administrator, so that they are informed of the Meta Analyst's decision on their product access request.

Email template:

Approval :  https://xd.adobe.com/view/19ac2f03-bcbe-4635-829c-46c8bb269c46-4cff/screen/8d10edca-31be-4de0-b196-62b3227ac618/

Rejection : 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/19ac2f03-bcbe-4635-829c-46c8bb269c46-4cff/screen/459a8c85-41f7-4f3f-a8ed-d989c1212938/

Acceptance Criteria:
1. An email notification should be sent to the corporate administrator on their registered email address when the Meta Analyst approves or rejects their product access request.
2. The email should contain details of the decision and any next steps required.
3. The Approval email shall contain a Complete Settings CTA, which redirects the admin to the Settings page
4. The rejection email shall contain a reason for rejection as entered by MA while rejecting.
4. Email shall be sent from support@mettasocila.com
5.Email shall be sent to registered corporate email address

User Story 1.2 - Azure AD Setting
tasks.description:
As a corp admin, I should have facility to add required information related to Azure Active Directory so that employee can access the application seamlessly

UI Design:
https://xd.adobe.com/view/88b7737a-d4ac-465f-b3bc-40734c42d819-dde4/screen/5b8c67f7-032f-4f0e-9e7a-aaf305ef6b1f/specs/

Trigger Point :
When user selects an option from General Settings ➝ Employee Onboarding ➝ SSO ➝ Microsoft AD 
Once the admin select a Microsoft AD as SSO option, a flyer should open which will ask for basic information such as Client ID and Client Secret using which employee can access the both the application using SSO

Acceptance Criteria: 
The corporate admin should be able to see the "Employee Onboarding" tab.
The corporate admin should be able to select and deselect the "Microsoft AD" option.
Once the AD setting is done, it should display a label as "Settings Saved"
Clicking on the "Save and Proceed" button should route the user to the AD setup page.
https://xd.adobe.com/view/88b7737a-d4ac-465f-b3bc-40734c42d819-dde4/screen/5b8c67f7-032f-4f0e-9e7a-aaf305ef6b1f/specs/
Client ID and Client Secret are mandatory fields.
Client ID and Client Secret should be saved in the database upon clicking the "Save" button.
The cancel button on Flyer :
If user has made any unsaved changes it shall show a popup with a message and a confirm button as "Are you sure you want to cancel the unsaved changes?" 
If user do not have any unsaved changes the cancel button shall redirect user to the last page.
Clicking the "Cancel" button or clicking outside the flyer should navigate back to the initial employee onboarding screen.

tasks.title: User Story 1.4 - Employee Login Using Azure AD as SSO
tasks.description:
As an employee, I want to log in to the application using my Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) account via Single Sign-On (SSO), so that I can access the application easily and securely without needing to create a new set of credentials.

UI Link : 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/e64f656c-5901-43d6-96a7-53492e90cf5f-b31c/screen/67b980e1-a56f-4ab8-910c-fdcf200e60c6/

Acceptance Criteria:
Login Option:
A "Login with Azure AD" button is prominently displayed on the application's login page.
Redirection to Azure AD:
Clicking the "Login with Azure AD" button redirects the user to the Azure AD login page.
Azure AD Authentication:
The user can enter their Azure AD credentials and successfully authenticate on the Azure AD login page.
Redirection to Application:
Engage-XN :
After successful authentication, the user is redirected back to the Engage -XN application and should route to cause selection page .
Link - https://xd.adobe.com/view/ffa7ff19-23af-40a5-904f-ff3af2cabebb-aaf4/screen/17a25e44-2dca-4c30-a800-94af3d1bed8d/
iGiv-XN :
After successful authentication, the user is redirected back to the iGiv -XN application and should route to cause selection page .
Link : https://xd.adobe.com/view/a6493a5f-9b9f-48da-9008-c697e5b686eb-f31a/screen/d1d454c8-5cfb-474b-a790-63bb2645ae58/
Access Granted:
The user is logged into the application without needing to enter additional credentials.
Account Creation:
If the user is logging in for the first time using their Azure AD account, a new user account is automatically created in the Engage-XN or iGiv-XN application based on corp admin setting. 
If the employee has access for both the products (iGiv-XN & Engage-XN) then only single user account should be valid and employee can take advantage of both the products
Employees will log in to the application using Azure AD. Admins of both the applications, however, will log in via the standard 'Sign Up' process, as organisation details are required from them.
Existing Account Match:
If the user has previously logged in using the same Azure AD email, the existing account is recognised, and they are logged in.
Security:
The login process uses secure protocols to protect the user’s data.
User sessions are managed securely with appropriate expiration policies.
Error Handling:
Clear and informative error messages are displayed if the login process fails at any point.
Users are provided with troubleshooting steps or contact information for support if needed.
User Experience:
The login process is smooth, quick, and intuitive, enhancing the overall user experience.

tasks.title: Search bar required on All Events page
tasks.description:
As a corporate employee, I should be able to search for events so that it can aid me in event participation process.

Design reference : 

https://xd.adobe.com/view/ffa7ff19-23af-40a5-904f-ff3af2cabebb-aaf4/screen/a09d0b27-56e7-46f2-ae29-1ab455869f8d


Acceptance criteria:
A search bar shall be integrated at the top enabling users to search by city, state, and event name.
It shall be a smart search
If a user applies any other filter like event type, cause(s), or mode along with search query, in this case, the result shall be the AND operation of all i.e search query nd all the filters applied.
Note: Filters and search bar shall work in coordination to show the results
If no result is found, an empty screen shall be shown.
If users clicks on the Reset filter, the search parameter searched earlier shall get removed and all the events shall be shown.
Placeholder for search bar shall be: Search by Event Name, City, State.
The label for "All Events(n)", count of n shall be handled according to result shown

tasks.title: Corp Employee : Active registered employee details
tasks.description:
As a corp employee, I should be able to see the number of people who have registered for an event so that I can make a decision.

Acceptance criteria:
Every employee who has registered for an event shall be displayed in a circle with their initials on the circle.
Upon hovering over the respective circle, the employee's name shall be displayed as a tooltip.
If number of employees who have registered exceeds 4, other entries shall be shown as a count in a circle as per design reference.
If any employee has dropped out, their entry shall get removed from here.
Only active employees shall be shown here.

It is visible on all the below screens:

Cards on All events page: https://xd.adobe.com/view/ffa7ff19-23af-40a5-904f-ff3af2cabebb-aaf4/screen/a09d0b27-56e7-46f2-ae29-1ab455869f8d

tasks.title: Mobile - Community admin: Add Member to existing Communities
tasks.description:
As a corporate admin, I should be able to add members to already existing communities so that I can join more people who share the same interests as my community

Design ref :
https://xd.adobe.com/view/584b8ca8-ee01-4d1c-9efb-5e8d95534ae2-0d18/screen/1678cd17-db8f-467a-a1b8-0c92ece06cb1/specs/

Acceptance criteria : 
A list of employees who are currently not a part of the community shall be shown to the community admin.
Employees shall be sorted on the order of BU(Preferrable) if employees have filled BU in their profile, otherwise, a random list of employees shall be shown.
Admin shall be able to search for the member he wants to add to the community.
Once the admin clicks on the add button, a message as "{Employee_Name} Successfully added" shall be displayed.
Community members who were previously part of the community but later removed from it shall also be shown in the add member list.
Newly added community members shall be able to view the community in its My Community section and newly added members shall be able to send messages/photos/gifs etc.
Existing community members shall receive a notification (within the Community) when a new member joins as "{Admin_Name} added {New_Member_name}".

tasks.description:
Currently, the platform features two separate search options within the chat interface:
"Chat with Buddies" Search: Displays all employees who have signed up on the platform, irrespective of chat initiation.
Left-Side Search: Displays only those employees with whom the user has already initiated a conversation.

Problem:
Having two search options creates confusion 
It results in inconsistent user experience, as users must refer to different searches for different purposes.
Proposed Solution
Remove the "Chat with Buddies" search.
Implement a single, unified search bar at the top of the chat interface.This search will display all employees on the platform, whether or not they have initiated a chat.

A list of employees who are currently not a part of the community shall be shown to the community admin.
Employees shall be sorted on the order of BU(Preferrable) if employees have filled BU in their profile, otherwise, a random list of employees shall be shown.
Admin shall be able to search for the member he wants to add to the community.
Once the admin clicks on the add button, a message as "{Employee_Name} Successfully added" shall be displayed.
Community members who were previously part of the community but later removed from it shall also be shown in the add member list.
Newly added community members shall be able to view the community in its My Community section and newly added members shall be able to send messages/photos/gifs etc.
Existing community members shall receive a notification (within the Community) when a new member joins as "{Admin_Name} added {New_Member_name}".

tasks.title: User Story 2.3 - Select Default Avatar When Creating Profile
tasks.description:
As a New or existing employee creating or updating their profile I want to use the "Use Avatar" feature to choose an avatar from a default list So that I can personalise my profile with a predefined avatar from the available options
Design reference : 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/584b8ca8-ee01-4d1c-9efb-5e8d95534ae2-0d18/screen/a4635c6b-d606-42c6-b2cc-07800e08efbe/specs/

Acceptance Criteria:
Avatar Selection Feature:
When an employee redirects to profile , there should be a "Use Avatar" option available.
Clicking on "Use Avatar" should display a list of default avatars.
Default Avatar List:
The list should include a variety of default avatars  to choose from.
There should be radio buttons to choose avatars based on gender. If no gender is selected, a mix of both should be displayed on the screen. If a gender radio button is selected then a segregated avatar list should be displayed.
     3. Avatar Selection:
An employee should be able to select an avatar from the list by clicking on it.
The selected avatar should be applied to the user’s profile on the click of Save.
Default Avatar Handling:
If the user does not select an avatar, a default placeholder of first name and last name should be applied automatically.
If an employee selects his or her original photo as an engagement-xn profile picture then the selected picture should be displayed on the profile without a delay.
On the click of “Close” button, an default placeholder of first name and last name should be applied if an employee is not selected profile photo or avatar.

tasks.title: User Story 2.1 - User can search and share GIFs using Giphy
tasks.description:
As an employee, I want to search for and share GIFs directly within the community application so thatI can express myself more creatively and enhance my communication with others

Acceptance Criteria:
Search Functionality:
Given that an employee is logged into the community app, when I navigate to the chat feature(one to one or community), I should see a "GIF" button/icon.
When I tap the "GIF" button, a search bar should appear where I can enter keywords to search for GIFs.
As I type in the search bar, I should see a list of GIFs that match my search criteria displayed in a grid format.
GIF Selection:
When I see a list of GIFs, I can scroll through them and tap on any GIF to select it.
Upon selecting a GIF, it should be inserted into the chat input area.
Sending GIFs:
After a GIF is selected and appears in the chat input area, I can send it as part of my message by tapping the send button.
The selected GIF should be displayed in the chat history as part of the conversation.
Error Handling:
If there is an issue with fetching GIFs (e.g., network error), I should see an error message indicating that GIFs could not be loaded.
If a GIF fails to send, I should be notified with an option to retry.
Performance:
The GIF search and selection process should be quick and responsive, with minimal delay in loading and sending GIFs.
User Experience:
The integration should be intuitive and seamless, with a consistent look and feel that matches the rest of the app.
There should be visual feedback (e.g., loading indicators) while GIFs are being fetched or sent.

Additional Notes:
The Giphy integration should respect the app's privacy policies and terms of use.
Consider implementing a feature to view trending or popular GIFs without searching.

tasks.title: User Story 4.2 - Admin Role Management and Automatic Assignment
tasks.description:
As a community chat participant I want to ensure proper admin oversight with automatic admin assignment when only one admin remains, and manual assignment when more than one admin is present So that the group can continue to be managed effectively without interruption
Design reference : 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/584b8ca8-ee01-4d1c-9efb-5e8d95534ae2-0d18/screen/f0a8de29-738d-47ed-a9fa-1d131f4882b6/specs/
Triggered point: 
Click on any community -> All Community Members -> Select any member from the list of community members.
Acceptance Criteria: 
Automatic Admin Assignment (Single Admin Scenario):
If there is only one admin in the group and that admin leaves, a new admin should be automatically assigned from the remaining group members.
The new admin should be assigned based on a random selection.

Manual Admin Assignment (Multiple Admins Scenario):
If there are more than one admin and one admin leaves, no automatic assignment will occur.
The remaining admins must manually assign a new admin from the remaining members on click of “Make Admin” button.
On clicking on the “Confirm” button, a pop-up should appear for the confirmation of making new admin
Design reference -  https://xd.adobe.com/view/584b8ca8-ee01-4d1c-9efb-5e8d95534ae2-0d18/screen/2f629238-4258-4456-a149-7b7a539bd77e/specs/

Notification:
All group members should receive a notification when a new admin is automatically assigned or manually assigned in the community chat feature.

Admin Capabilities:
The newly assigned admin, whether by automatic or manual assignment, should have the same permissions as the previous admin, including managing group settings, adding/removing members, and moderating content.
Admin Identification:
The new admin should be clearly identified within the community chat (e.g., with a badge or label next to their name).
https://xd.adobe.com/view/584b8ca8-ee01-4d1c-9efb-5e8d95534ae2-0d18/screen/8f7d20a4-06ae-41fb-b120-38249652ec56/specs/

https://xd.adobe.com/view/584b8ca8-ee01-4d1c-9efb-5e8d95534ae2-0d18/screen/03af835f-8d9f-48a5-8fee-61b019673c13/specs/
Acceptance Criteria:
Default Admin Assignment:
Given that I create a community chat, I should automatically be assigned the admin role.
I should have full admin permissions from the moment the group is created.
Only two admins should be allowed.
Admin Permissions:
As the default admin, I should have the ability to add and remove members from the group.
I should have the ability to edit the community name and description, and the community image and background picture.
I should have the ability to moderating content
I should have the ability to assign admin roles to other members.
I should have the ability to delete the community
     3.  Admin Identification:
The community admin should be clearly identified with “Admin” tag within the community chat

tasks.title: User Story 2.4 - Cross Product Access Role Management for Small-Sized Company (Same User)
tasks.description:
As an HR Manager, if I am upgrading my profile from iGiv-XN or Engage-XN to Socio-XN, I should receive the CSR Super Admin role so that I can access CSR product-related services on the Metta Social platform.
Expectation:
In small-sized companies, the CSR and HR teams are often the same, leading to a high likelihood that the same user will require access to multiple products.
In this situation, the user requesting access will be granted the Super Admin role for the requested product once the Metta analyst approves their profile.

Acceptance Criteria:
Assigning CSR Super Admin Role:
If the HR Manager has “iGiv-XN” product access and requests access to “Socio-XN,” the CSR-Super Admin role should be assigned to the user.
Assigning Engage-XN or iGiv-XN Super Admin Role:
If the HR Manager has “Socio-XN” product access and requests access to “iGiv-XN,” “Engage-XN,” or both, the respective Super Admin role should be assigned to the HR Manager.
Admin Portal Access:
Based on the assigned role, the user should be able to access the admin portal of iGiv-XN or Engage-XN.
Super Admin Functionality for Socio-XN:
For Socio-XN, the Super Admin functionality should work as it currently does.

tasks.title: iGiv-XN Regional Setting
tasks.description:
As an employee, I should be able to select a timezone from my employee profile so that i can get emails and other notifications as per my timezone.

Design reference : 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/74a7a76a-b627-4285-b472-b293bdd7e5ab-21f4/screen/abb97ad0-31d3-4835-9d19-7ffd45c1196f/

Acceptance criteria : 
Employee Profile: In the Employee’s Profile, a new field TimeZone needs to be added.





Field name
Mandatory
Field type
Remarks
Timezone
Yes
Single select dropdown
Values should be fetched from TimeZone master data
The timezone field shall be auto-populated, based on what corporate admin has selected while filling the regional settings.
Profile Completion Requirement: Employees shall not be able to save their profile without filling in all the mandatory fields, including the new TimeZone field.
Update Profile Popup: The update profile popup, which appears when an employee needs to fill in mandatory profile settings, shall now include the TimeZone field.

Important Note 
Data Migration:
For existing corporate employees in production, the TimeZone data shall be migrated manually to avoid any unnecessary update profile popups that could disrupt the employee experience.

tasks.title: User story 6.2:  Automatic email generation and emailing to employees
tasks.description:
As a system, I shall be able to generate certificates automatically for completed events so that I  can then share it to participants.

Design reference : 
Certificate template : https://xd.adobe.com/view/959f8b73-d7a3-4d9f-83ec-dc95426c3cb9-c0cc/screen/e43e1cd6-2b8b-4c88-a3be-5591dc93dce3/

Email template : 

Subject: You've Earned Your Volunteering Certificate!

Dear [Employee’s Name],
Your incredible work at [Event Name] on [Event Date] made a huge difference! As a token of our appreciation, we’re excited to share your volunteer certificate.
Share you certificate on your social handle and showcase your dedication, inspire others, and boost your career. To view your certificate click below.
 
[View Certificate]
Thank you again for your amazing contribution!
Attachment: [Certificate_File.pdf]

Acceptance criteria : 
The system shall generate certificates automatically for completed events after attendance is being uploaded for them.
When the attendance is uploaded via manual upload by NGO, certificates shall be triggered after it. 
When the attendance is uploaded via QR attendance shall be considered after event has been successfully marked completed with its attendance being uploaded as well
Certificates shall only be generated for Volunteering and Sustainable events.
The certificate generation script shall run as soon as the attendance is uploaded for the completed event.
If the NGO that was involved in the event has not uploaded the NGO stamp and authorized signature this jo should not run.
The certificate will contain, the NGO name, NGO Stamp, Company logo, and Ngo’s Authorised signature as well as the Event date and Event name
An email shall be triggered to all the employees who have attended the event.
The email shall also mention the event name.
The email shall contain an “View Certificate” CTA which redirects the user to the engage-Xn platform completed events page.
The email shall contain a certificate attachment and the Certificate file name shall be “Certificate_File.pdf”.
The email shall be sent on the registered profession email address of employees.

tasks.title: Epic 6: Certificate Generation and Employee Sharing
tasks.description:
We want to create a system that automatically sends certificates to employees who attend Volunteering and Sustainable events. This will make it easier to recognize and reward their participation without manual effort.

Acceptance Criteria:
Certificates are generated automatically for all employees who attended the Volunteering or Sustainable events.
Employees can access their certificates through an email link or attachment.
The system correctly processes and generates certificates based on event attendance data.

tasks.title: User Story 2.3 - Approval Process from Metta analyst
tasks.description:
As a Metta analyst, whenever a user upgrades their profile, a record should be sent to me for approval before the corporate can access new Metta Social services.
Expectation:
Whenever a user is upgrading their profile, assuming they already have access to at least one product and are requesting access to another product, it should be considered a modification scenario.
The modification workflow should work as usual.
A record should be sent to the “Pending Access” tab for approval.
Upon clicking the tab, the Metta analyst should be able to approve the profile as per the existing process.
Acceptance Criteria:
Profile Submission:
Once the user with the same email ID completes and submits their company profile, a existing company record should appear in the “Pending Access” tab for Metta analyst approval.
Pending Access Tab:
The record should be visible in the “Pending Access” tab and require approval from a Metta analyst.
Approved Tab:
A record of the currently approved product(s) being used by the corporate should be present in the “Approved” tab.
Approval/Rejection Page:
Upon clicking the row in the Pending Access tab, an approval/rejection page should open with all corporate details for the Metta analyst.
Approved product information and labels should be visible on the Profile page as they currently are.
If the product is Socio-XN, the approval and rejection should occur on the same page.
If the product is other than Socio-XN, a flyer should open for the approval and rejection process.
Once the metta-analyst approves the upgrade profile, a corresponding new product should be enabled on kitkat menu along with the existing product list
New User Entry:
In the case of a different user, a new record entry should be available.
Role Assignment:
Once the Metta analyst approves the profile, the respective role should be assigned to the user.

tasks.title: User Story 2.2 - Accessing Metta Social Platform Products for Large Companies (Different User ID)
tasks.description:
As a CSR or HR manager of a large company, I want to access the Socio-XN product for CSR-related services or the iGiv-XN or Engage-XN products with different user id for engagement-related services offered by the Metta Social Platform.

Pre-Condition: Corp profile should be in “Approved” status

Expectation:
If the user uses a different email ID even with the same CIN number, they should be allowed to proceed and enter the system.
If the same CIN number is observed in the current system, existing details should be fetched from the system.
The remaining sections should be enabled as usual based on product access.

All the cases that should be considered :

Case 1 - Corp has iGiv-XN or Engage-XN access and want to access for Socio-XN: 
Account Owner: This section contains information about the user who originally created the account, and this information should be unchangeable.
Organization Details: These details should be automatically fetched based on the CIN number and must remain unchangeable.
Product Selection: This field should be pre-filled based on the CIN number and should not be changeable.
Thematic Area Focus: This section should be enabled for new users to fill out.
CSR Details: This section should be enabled for new users to fill out. 
Custom URL: This will be system-generated.

Case 2 - Corp has "Socio-XN" access and requesting for any single product or combination of both(iGiv-XN or Engage-XN)
Account Owner: This section contains information about the user who originally created the account, and this information should be unchangeable.
Organization Details: These details should be automatically fetched based on the CIN number and must remain unchangeable.
Product Selection: This section should be enabled for new users to fill out.
Thematic Area Focus: This field should be pre-filled based on the CIN number and should not be changeable.
CSR Details: These should be pre-filled based on the CIN number and should remain unchangeable.
Custom URL: This section should be enabled for new users to fill out. The URL should be system-generated

Acceptance Criteria:
Routing to Sign Up Form:
The user should be routed from the respective product URL to the Sign Up form.
Account Creation:
The user should be able to successfully create an account using a different email ID.
Fetching Details Based on CIN:
If the same CIN number is observed in the system, all relevant details should be fetched based on the CIN number.
Account Owner Details:
The account owner details should reflect the individual who initially created the account for any product. First account owner. 
Editable Sections:
All pre-filled information based on the product should be non-editable.
Functionality Consistency:
All other functionalities should work as they do for account creation, as the new user is trying to access the system.
  7. Profile Submission:
After profile submission an existing email should be triggered to Metta analyst. 
The profile status should be changed from “Approved” to “Under Review” 
  8. Role Management:

tasks.title: User Story 2.1 - Accessing Metta Social Platform Products for Small Companies (Same User ID)
tasks.description:
As an HR Manager of a small-sized company, I would like to access the Socio-XN or iGiv-XN or Engage-XN products so that I can utilise CSR related or engagement-related services offered by the Metta Social Platform.

Pre-Condition: Corp profile should be in “Approved” status

Design reference : 
Case 1 - 
Corp has iGiv-XN or Engage-XN and want to access for Socio-XN: 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/ca7587c1-c347-4e3c-ac4a-cd362686233b-9f26/screen/e36d35ef-6534-429d-83e9-38e025006d44

Case 2 - 
Corp has "Socio-XN" and requesting for iGiv-XN or Engage-XN or both:
//Design

Expectation : 
1. Account Creation and Sign-In Process:
The HR manager will go to the Metta Social platform and attempt to create an account or sign up for the Socio-XN product.
 If the account already exists, Keycloak will notify the user that the account already exists, prompting them to follow the sign-in process.
https://xd.adobe.com/view/ca7587c1-c347-4e3c-ac4a-cd362686233b-9f26/screen/7b6f5212-b236-4530-970d-871ac42054ee

This process should also be applicable and vice versa for users trying to access other products (iGiv-XN or Engage-XN).

2. OTP Verification:
   - Once signed in, the user should enter the system using OTP verification.
   - An OTP should be sent to the user's registered email address.
   - After successful OTP verification, the user should be routed to the Profile section or Product Setting page of the corporate.
https://xd.adobe.com/view/ca7587c1-c347-4e3c-ac4a-cd362686233b-9f26/screen/856657d1-b80b-4634-a7be-56523d3857ef

3. If user already have "iGiv-XN" or "Engage-XN" access and requesting for "Socio-XN" in that case HR manager will fill all the field related to CSR such as (Thematic Area, CSR Details). If user already have "Socio-XN" access and requesting for "iGiv-XN" or "Engage-XN" in that case HR manager will fill all the field related to iGiv-XN or Engage-XN such as (Product Selection) 
4. HR Manager will submit their profile to Metta Analyst

Acceptance criteria: 
1. Email Restriction:
   - If the HR Manager is using an existing account, they should be restricted from creating an account on the Metta Social platform using the same email ID.
2. Sign In Feature:
   - The HR Manager should see the “Sign In” feature prominently.
3. Successful Login:
   - The HR Manager should be able to complete a successful login.
4. OTP Screen:
   - After logging in, the HR Manager should see the OTP screen to restrict initial access to CSR.
   - Note : This should only happen when a user is trying to upgrade their profile. If the profile is complete then the user should be able to enter the system without OTP.
5. Successful OTP Validation:
   - Upon successful OTP validation, the HR Manager should be routed to the Profile section.
6. Unsuccessful OTP Validation:
   - If the OTP validation is unsuccessful, the user should remain on the OTP verification page within the current session.
7. Enabling Sections for Socio-XN Request:
   - If the user is requesting access to “Socio-XN” and already has access to iGiv or Engage, the sections “Thematic Area Focus” and “CSR Details” should be enabled on profile for the corp admin (Super admin) to fill out the form.
In this case profile will be submitted again only for Socio-XN and all the other tabs related to iGiv and Engage should be visible as it is. 
8. Enabling Sections for iGiv-XN or Engage-XN Request:
   - If the user is requesting access to “iGiv-XN” or “Engage-XN” and already has access to “Socio-XN,” the sections “Product Selection” and “Custom URL” should be enabled on profile.
In this case profile will be submitted again only for individual product or combination of both. and all the other product settings tab will be enable after approval. 
9. Profile Page Validations:
   - All existing validations on the Profile page should function as they currently do.
10. Profile Submission:
- After profile submission, an existing email should be triggered to Metta analyst. (Ref : https://xd.adobe.com/view/19ac2f03-bcbe-4635-829c-46c8bb269c46-4cff/screen/f56134ec-fd2a-40e0-8895-30059cf88d34/)
- The profile status should be changed from “Approved” to “Under Review”

tasks.title: Epic 2 - Socio-XN Product Access combination with Other two(Engage-XN & iGiv-XN) product and vice versa
tasks.description:
In this epic, we are going to consider cross-product access scenarios. If an HR manager has access to Socio-XN and is requesting access to either or both of the other two products (iGiv-XN and Engage-XN), or vice versa, we need to consider the following scenarios:

1. HR manager has Socio-XN access and is requesting access to only the iGiv-XN product.
2. HR manager has Socio-XN access and is requesting access to only the Engage-XN product.
3. HR manager has Socio-XN access and is requesting access to both iGiv-XN and Engage-XN products.
4. HR manager has iGiv-XN access and is requesting access to the Socio-XN product.
5. HR manager has Engage-XN access and is requesting access to the Socio-XN product.
6. HR manager has access to both iGiv-XN and Engage-XN products and is requesting access to the Socio-XN product.

Additionally, we need to consider two cases:
- Scenario 1: The same user requests access to all three products.
- Scenario 2: A completely different person requests access to all three products.

tasks.title: Sorting required for Events for Corp admin
tasks.description:
Sorting is needed for "All Events" on the corp admin side.
Drafts

New Requests

Order: Most recent requests from NGOs are shown first.
Submitted
Sorting: Based on the submitted date.
Order: Recent submissions are displayed at the top.
Published
Sorting: Based on the publication date.
Order: Most recently published events appear at the top.
Completed
Sorting: Based on the completion date.
Order: Recently completed events are listed at the top.
Rejected
Sorting: Based on the rejection date.
Order: Recent rejections are displayed at the top.
Deactivated
Sorting: Based on the deactivation date.
Order: Recently deactivated events appear first.

tasks.title: Corp Settings: Handling Edge case of email
tasks.description:
As per our discussion, emails are triggered in the following scenarios:
If a corporate user selects the "Engage XN" product, the email should be triggered once all mandatory General Settings are filled.
If the user selects "Igiv XN," the email should be triggered once all mandatory General Settings and Payroll Settings are completed.
If the user selects both products, the email should be triggered once all mandatory General Settings and Payroll Settings are filled.
Additionally, there's another scenario that needs attention: If a user initially had the "Igiv XN" product and attempts to upgrade to "Engage XN," currently, the email is triggered based on the Engage XN settings, which are non-mandatory fields. Please review the comments and take the necessary action.

tasks.title: {10.10} Widget 10 : Displaying Event completion and success rate
tasks.description:
As a CORP administrator, I want to view information about completed events and their success rates, So that I can have an idea of events and volunteer participation.


Design reference:
https://xd.adobe.com/view/eb8f55e0-0277-4f39-a563-d8b97d4834e7-bedc/



Acceptance Criteria:

{All the calculation shall be calculated for the financial year selected in dropdown}

1. A single widget will be displayed on the dashboard, consisting of two sections side by side:
    a. The first section will show the number of completed events in the year chosen in the dropdown above. A label should be shown below “In n year”, n year is the year selected by user from dropdown
    b. The second section will display the success rate of completed events.

2. Completed events are defined as events marked as completed after the event's "To-Date" has passed, as set by the NGO or corp admin during event creation, or manually marked completed by the NGO or corp admin.
The "To-Date" for an event is determined by the NGO or corp admin during event creation and signifies the end date of the event.

3. The success rate of completed events will be calculated as follows:
   Success Rate = (Total number of volunteers who attended all completed events) / (Total number of volunteers who registered for the event).

4. The success rate calculation will consider the total number of volunteers who attended all completed events and the total number of volunteers who registered for those events.

5. The widget should dynamically update to reflect changes in completed events and success rates as events are marked completed or new events are added.

tasks.title: 10.8 Widget 8: Displaying Volunteer Drop Rate
tasks.description:
As a corp admin, I want to visualize the volunteer drop rate through a graph,
So that I can understand the rate of volunteer attendance and dropout for each event.

Design reference:
https://xd.adobe.com/view/eb8f55e0-0277-4f39-a563-d8b97d4834e7-bedc/


Acceptance criteria:

{All the calculations shall be calculated for the financial year selected in the dropdown}

1. A graph will be displayed on the platform illustrating the volunteer drop rate.
2. The graph will highlight two categories: "Dropout Volunteers" and "Going Volunteers".
The graph will highlight two categories: "Not Attended" and "Attended".
3. Not Attended Volunteers are defined as employees who registered for an event but did not attend.
4.  Attended Volunteers are employees who registered for and attended the event.
5. Data displayed in the graph should be based on historical attendance records for events.
6. Upon hovering over each section of the graph, the number of volunteers in that category should be displayed.

tasks.title: 10.7 Widget 7: Displaying Recurring vs New Volunteers
tasks.description:
As a corp admin, I want to be able to distinguish between recurring and new volunteers so that I can gain insights into volunteer retention.

Design reference:
https://xd.adobe.com/view/eb8f55e0-0277-4f39-a563-d8b97d4834e7-bedc/



Acceptance criteria:

{All the calculation shall be calculated for the financial year selected in dropdown}

1. On the dashboard, there should be a section displaying the breakdown of recurring and new volunteers.
2. Recurring volunteers are defined as those who have attended more than one event in the chosen year from the dropdown menu.
3. New volunteers are defined as those who have attended only one event in the chosen year.
4. The data should be dynamically updated based on the selected year from the dropdown menu.
5. Upon hovering over the recurring section on the graph, the number of recurring volunteers shall be shown.
6. Upon hovering over the New section on the graph, the number of new volunteers shall be shown.
7. The count of Recurring and New volunteers shall match the count shown in the “Employees volunteered” widget in the first row.

tasks.title: 10. 6 Widget 6: Displaying Overall Volunteer Particiption
tasks.description:
As a corporate admin, I want to have visibility into the volunteer participation for completed events


Design reference:

https://xd.adobe.com/view/eb8f55e0-0277-4f39-a563-d8b97d4834e7-bedc/



Acceptance criteria:

{All the calculation shall be calculated for the financial year selected in dropdown}


Corp Admin shall be able to see a graph showing volunteer participation for all the completed events in the year selected in the dropdown.
The graph will display months on the x-axis and the number of volunteers on the y-axis, with the y-axis marked with positive integers spaced by 10, such as 0, 10, 20, 30, and so on.
Volunteer participation will be calculated for each volunteer who has attended the event.
	Note: Attendance is manually uploaded by the NGO after the completion of each event or if the employee checks in and checks out using QR.
If an event is marked as completed but the attendance has not been uploaded by the NGO yet, volunteers who registered and attended this event will not be counted here. 
A tooltip shall be shown after the user hovers over the graph for each month, showing the Volunteer participation for that month.
The Sum of all the volunteer participation for each month shall be equal to the “Employees Volunteered” widget count shown on the first row.

tasks.title: 10.4 Widget 4: Monetary value of volunteering
tasks.description:
As a corporate admin, I want to be able to see the Monetary value of volunteering for completed events on my volunteering platform.

Design reference:
https://xd.adobe.com/view/eb8f55e0-0277-4f39-a563-d8b97d4834e7-bedc/



Acceptance criteria:

{All the calculation shall be calculated for the financial year selected in dropdown}

The corporate admin should be able to view a widget displaying the "Monetary value of volunteering" on the platform.
The monetary value of volunteering shall be calculated using the following formula:
	      Total number of Hours volunteered to date by all employees *  Average monetary allocation per person per hour.
 The total number of hours volunteered to date by all employees refers to the total hours completed by corporate employees to date.
The Average monetary allocation per person is the value set by the corporate admin in the settings section under Account Settings -> Volunteering Settings -> Average monetary allocation per person. This indicates the amount allocated to each person for volunteer hours contributed
Below this a label shall be shown as “Out of n”, n is the “Total monetary allocation of volunteering” set by corp admin in Account Settings -> Volunteering Settings -> Total monetary allocation of volunteering”.

tasks.title: 10.3 Widget 3: Tracking Numbers of Hours Volunteered
tasks.description:
As a corp admin, I shall be able to see the number of hours volunteered by my employees

Design reference:

https://xd.adobe.com/view/eb8f55e0-0277-4f39-a563-d8b97d4834e7-bedc/



Acceptance criteria:

{All the calculation shall be calculated for the financial year selected in dropdown}

Corp admin shall be able to see a widget for “Number of hours volunteered” by its employees till date.
Volunteer hours will only be calculated for completed events.
Volunteer hours will be counted once the attendance for completed events is uploaded by the NGO.
Only employees who have both registered and attended the event will have their volunteer hours counted.
Volunteer hours for employees who have registered but not attended the event shall not be included in the total count.

tasks.title: [EPIC 10][Volunteering Dashboard for corp admin]
Epic 6 : Generate QR Code for the Published Event
tasks.description:
As a corporate or NGO administrator,
I want a QR code to be automatically generated by the system once an event is published,
So that attendees can easily access event information and registration.
Acceptance Criteria:
The QR code should only be created for events that have been published.
The QR code must be displayed on the screen at midnight before the event starts.
The QR code should be linked to either the Event ID or the event title for easy identification.
The QR code should remain valid from the event start date and time until the end date and time, providing access to event details throughout the duration.
The QR code should be covered for all offline events and all types (DEI and volunteering) of events.

tasks.title: Calculate Success Rate Based on Volunteer Attendance
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, I want to calculate the success rate of all our events based on the comparison between the total number of expected volunteers and the total number of actual volunteers who attended each event individually.



Acceptance Criteria:
The system should be able to calculate the success rate for each event by comparing the total number of expected volunteers against the total number of actual volunteers who attended the event.
The expected number of volunteers for each event should be determined and recorded prior to the event based on the organization's planning and outreach efforts.
The actual number of volunteers who attended each event should be accurately recorded and updated in the system following the event's conclusion.
The success rate calculation should be expressed as a percentage, where success rate = (total number of actual volunteers / total number of expected volunteers) * 100.
The success rate for each event should be visible and easily accessible to NGO users through the organization's dashboard or analytics section.
Users should be able to view the success rates for individual events as well as aggregated data for multiple events over a specific time period.
The success rate calculation should be dynamic and updated in real-time as new data about volunteer attendance becomes available.

tasks.title: Analyze Volunteer Drop-Out Rates with Pie Chart Visualization
tasks.description:
As an NGO, I should have the facility to view the percentage of drop-out volunteers represented in a pie chart. This will enable me to understand the reasons for volunteer attrition and update our execution plan accordingly.

UI mock-up:


Acceptance Criteria:
On the NGO dashboard or analytics section, there should be a dedicated feature to visualize the percentage of drop-out volunteers using a pie chart.
Each segment of the pie chart should be labeled with the corresponding reason for drop-out, making it easy for users to identify and interpret the data.
pie chart should clearly display the attrition rate and attendance rate based on the completed and published event
This should be displayed based on the time frame selected by NGO
Dropout and attendance should be considered across all the events published and completed by the NGO.

tasks.title: Visualise Volunteer Engagement with Recurring vs. One-Time Volunteers
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, I want to see whether volunteers are recurring or one-time participants, enabling me to understand their interest in our completed mission. I require a pie chart that displays the percentage of participation for each category of volunteer.



Acceptance Criteria:
On the NGO dashboard or analytics section, there should be a dedicated feature to visualize volunteer engagement, specifically categorizing volunteers as recurring or one-time participants
The pie chart should clearly display two segments representing recurring volunteers and one-time volunteers, respectively.
The percentage of participation for each category (recurring vs. one-time) should be calculated and displayed within the pie chart.
The pie chart should be interactive, allowing users to hover over each segment to view the exact percentage and number of volunteers represented.
Data for the pie chart should be derived from the NGO's volunteer attendance system uploaded by NGO, capturing volunteer participation across various events and initiatives.
The pie chart should dynamically update as new volunteer participation data becomes available, ensuring that users always have access to the most current information regarding volunteer engagement.
Users should have the option to filter the data displayed in the pie chart based on specific time periods selected by NGO user

tasks.title: Track Volunteering Participation Growth with Monthly Line Chart
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, I should have the facility to track volunteer participation growth every month using a line chart. so that I will analyze trends and make informed decisions regarding our strategy for volunteer engagement and outreach.

UI Mock-up:


Acceptance Criteria:
On the NGO dashboard or analytics section, there should be a dedicated feature to display volunteer participation growth over time using a line chart.
The line chart should represent the number of volunteers participating in NGO events for each month, with each month plotted along the x-axis and the corresponding number of participants plotted along the y-axis.
The line chart should be interactive, allowing users to hover over data points to view specific details such as the number of volunteers for a particular month.
Line chart should display a data based on the year of selection done by NGO user
The line chart should dynamically update as new volunteer participation data becomes available, ensuring that users always have access to the most up-to-date information.

tasks.title: View Corporate Interest by Cause Category
tasks.description:
As an NGO, I should have the facility to assess corporate interest based on cause categories. The interest level will be determined by the number of events approved by corporate partners within each cause category.

UI Mock-up:


Acceptance Criteria:
On the NGO dashboard or analytics section, there should be a feature to view corporate interest categorized by cause categories
Cause categories should encompass the various areas of focus supported by the NGO, such as environment, education, healthcare, etc.
The system should calculate and display the total number of events approved by corporate partners for each cause category.
Corporate interest should be quantified and reflected as the number of events approved within each cause category.
On clicking of each category, an NGO user should be routed to "published" event section
The displayed data should be dynamic and updated in real-time to reflect any changes in the number of approved events within each cause category.

tasks.title: Track Completed Events vs. Published Events
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, I should be able to see the number of completed events compared to the number of events published by my organization. Completed events are those where corporate partners have successfully executed the event in accordance with the planned objectives.

UI mock-up:



Acceptance Criteria:
On the NGO dashboard, there should be a dedicated section displaying the number of completed events alongside the number of events published by the organization.
Completed events should only include those where corporate partners have executed the event successfully and updated the attendance or have yet to update the attendance.
The count for completed events should update dynamically and in real-time to accurately reflect any changes as events are completed or new events are published.

tasks.title: Monitor Published Events vs. Submitted Events
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, I should be able to see the number of published events compared to the number of events submitted by my organization. Published events refer to those where corporate entities have accepted and approved the volunteering event, signifying their commitment to the execution plan

UI Mock-up:


Acceptance Criteria:
On the NGO dashboard, there should be a clear and distinct section displaying the number of published events and the number of events submitted by the organization
The count of published events should only include those where corporate entities have formally accepted and approved the volunteering event for execution.
The count of submitted events should reflect all events that have been proposed or submitted by the NGO, regardless of their acceptance status by corporate entities.
The displayed counts should update dynamically and in real-time to accurately reflect any changes in the status of published or submitted events.
Clicking on the counts for published events, an NGO user should be routed to "Published" event section

tasks.title: Volunteer Hours Metrics for NGO Events
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, I should have metrics that explain the total number of expected hours for which volunteers are expected to contribute compared to the number of actual hours volunteers contributed to my published events

UI mock-up:


Acceptance criteria:
It should accurately track and display the actual number of volunteer hours contributed by volunteers for each published event
The system should calculate and display the total number of expected volunteer hours for each published event based on the expected duration of the event and the number of volunteers expected to participate
The metrics should be accessible to NGO users through a designated dashboard or analytics section within the NGO's platform
The metrics should be updated in real-time or with minimal delay to reflect changes in volunteer participation and hours contributed.
On the click of this metric, an NGO user should route to "Completed" event section.

tasks.title: Number of Employees Who Volunteered
tasks.description:
These metrics will explain the total number of employees who actually attended the volunteering event published by my NGO in comparison to the total number of employees who opted to attend the event

UI mock-up: 


Acceptance criteria:
If the NGO publishes three events for single or multiple corporations, the total number of expected volunteers should be displayed
Additionally, for the three events published for single or multiple corporates, the volunteers who actually attended the event should be highlighted in this matrix
Upon clicking on the number, an NGO should be routed to the "Completed" event.

tasks.title: View Volunteering Event Dashboard on NGO Home Page
tasks.description:
As an NGO user, when I route to the home page, I should be able to see the overall dashboard of the NGO focusing on volunteering events.

All the widgets are covered as different user stories for tracking purposes.

As an Employee, I should be able to view a widget displaying the "Monetary value of volunteering" on the platform.

The app should have a clear and detailed description, screenshots, and user reviews on the App Store page.
The app's logo should be clear and visually appealing on the App Store.

tasks.title: Testing Application Compatibility with Microsoft Edge Browser
tasks.description:
As a QA engineer, I need to test my application using Microsoft Edge Browser Testing to ensure that all features and functionalities work correctly and consistently for users accessing the application through the Edge browser.

As a QA engineer, I want to perform comprehensive testing of my application using Microsoft Edge Browser so that I can identify and fix any browser-specific issues and ensure a seamless user experience for Edge users.
Acceptance Criteria:
The application should be thoroughly tested on the latest version of Microsoft Edge.
All functionalities, including forms, buttons, and interactive elements, should work correctly in Microsoft Edge.
The layout and design should be consistent and visually appealing across different screen sizes and resolutions in Microsoft Edge.
Performance metrics, such as load times and responsiveness, should meet the specified standards in Microsoft Edge.
Any issues or bugs identified during testing should be documented and reported for resolution.
The application should pass all relevant security and compatibility checks specific to Microsoft Edge.
Test results should be reviewed and verified to ensure the application provides a seamless user experience on Microsoft Edge.

Description:

Acceptance Criteria:

1. Segmented Control:

2.  The count of all the activities shall be shown on the label alongside status name on segmented control
3. The currently selected segment should be highlighted.
4.

tasks.title: User Story 9.3: Autocomplete Search for Activity Catalogue
tasks.description:
As a corp admin, I would like to see predictive search functionality based on keywords such as “activity name,"  “city," and “NGO name” so that relevant suggestions are displayed as I type in the search box.

Design:
https://xd.adobe.com/view/3fbf6b49-2e82-4b17-a861-83361e9d600f-6aec/screen/16f15ec5-f098-4860-be20-8c3a2a8091e6/

Acceptance criteria:
Search Bar Availability
The search bar is available on the activity catalog page.
The search bar is prominently displayed and easily accessible.
Autocomplete Functionality
When a user begins typing in the search box (minimum 3 letters), a drop-down menu should appear below the search bar.
The drop-down menu dynamically displays a maximum of 10 relevant suggestions based on the user's input.
Predictive search considers existing fields stored in the database to generate suggestions.
Users can select a suggestion from the drop-down menu to initiate the search immediately.
Keyword Search Functionality
Users can enter keywords in the search bar.
Keywords can include "Activity name", "City", “NGO name.”
Relevant Results
The system returns a list of activities matching the entered keywords.
Activities are filtered to include only those that contain the specified keywords in the "Activity name" "City," and " NGO Name” fields.
Enhanced User Experience
Predictive search enhances the overall user experience by speeding up the search process and guiding users to relevant content more efficiently.
Display appropriate tag for suggested search result: 
(Note : This is currently working for City and State in iGiv-XN.) 
The system returns a suggestion tag if the keyword is related to City. e.g if user is trying to search for a city as "Pune,” then tag should be displayed as "City.” 
The system returns a suggestion tag if the keyword is related to NGO Name. e.g if user is trying to search for an NGO as "Purnkuti,” then tag should be displayed as “NGO Name.” 
The system returns a suggestion tag if the keyword is related to the relevant tag. e.g if user is trying to search for the relevant tag as “Food Donation Program,” then tag should be displayed as “Activity Tag.”

tasks.title: Continuous Execution of Escrow Cron Job
tasks.description:
Background
Corporations typically send funds to the Escrow account after payday. On Payday + 4 days, our cron job runs to transfer these funds to various NGOs.

Job Execution Outcomes
Successful Execution:
NGOs receive the funds.
The admin panel updates the Distribution Receipts and Transaction tabs.
Unsuccessful Execution:
The job must be manually executed.
The admin panel does not update the Distribution Receipts and Transaction tabs due to manual job execution.
Causes of Unsuccessful Execution
Insufficient balance (balance < total money required).

Expected Outcome is : 
Continuous Balance Check
After payday, we should continuously check the balance to ensure the corporation has sent the expected (Monthly) amount if corporate opt for payroll giving.
If the balance is insufficient, an alternate-day email should be triggered to the finance team, prompting them to transfer the amount to the Escrow account.
Email Notification
Upon a successful transaction for the respective month, emails to the finance team should stop until the next payday cycle.
 https://xd.adobe.com/view/7faba4eb-a244-4591-b757-48736e35e054-2af8/screen/708eac0f-6a41-4507-ae94-38814d833d77/

tasks.title: Corp Admin: Inaccurate Donation History Due to Updated Pledge Amounts
tasks.description:
Problem Description:

It has been observed that when a user changes the donation amount for a pledge they were pledging earlier, the updated amount is incorrectly reflected in the employee donation history report for all previous transactions. This means the historical records display the "new amount" instead of the originally pledged amounts, leading to inaccurate donation history.

Impact Observed:

- On the Dashboard, the widgets for "Total donations received" and "Donations till date" display incorrect values.
- The sum of NGO donation history and employee donation history does not match.

Expectation:

- Even if an employee updates the donation amount, it should not override the older transaction values in the employee donation history report.
- The sum of the donation amounts in the employee donation history and NGO donation history should match for the same time frame.
- The total donation amount should be consistent across the dashboard and all related reports.

Screenshot : 
It can be observed that donation amount for same mission has been changed to 200 from 500

In report, it can be observed that in donation amount for all entries(of all the months) 200 is reflected.

tasks.title: Automated Reminder System for NGOs to provide updates
tasks.description:
As an NGO user of the payroll giving application,
I want to receive automated reminders to submit updates on our missions,
So that I can ensure timely communication with our donors and maintain their support.
Acceptance Criteria:
Reminder Schedule: The system should automatically schedule reminders after checking which NGOs had active donors last month and have not provided any update in the last month
Notification Delivery: Reminders should be delivered via email
Escalation for Non-Response: If an NGO fails to respond after several reminders, an escalation message should be sent, highlighting the importance of updates for continued donor support.

Design Link : https://xd.adobe.com/view/66385f53-d19d-4e95-9f6c-f51243a0cfc0-336b/screen/093353b2-bdb5-4367-88c4-dfeb4bc06a30/

Email content:

Subject: Urgent: Request for Mission Update
Title: Mission Update Required
Dear [NGO Name],
I trust this email finds you well. At iGiv-XN, we admire your impactful work and the support it gets from our enthusiastic donors. However, it’s been 3 months since your last update on missions. Regular updates are crucial for donor engagement and transparency. Kindly share recent developments, success stories, or milestones achived, as even small progress is worth celebrating. Your updates significantly influence donor confidence and ongoing support. We’re eager to showcase your incredible progress to your supporters. Please provide an update on all of your published missions at your earliest convenience.
Here is what you need to do
Log in to your iGiv-XN account
Navigate to the ‘Mission Updates’ section
Click on ‘Add New Update’ and share your latest news

Need Help? Email us at support@mettasocial.com.

Thank You, Team Metta Social

tasks.title: Test Case 6: Verify that the search functionality accurately filters NGOs based on the entered NGO name.
Verify that the Matching amount for each NGO is calculated accurately based on the provided example and formula.
tasks.description:
6. Matching Amount : 
To calculate the Matching amount for an NGO:
Step 1: Calculate the percentage (Weightage) of the amount that has been pledged to the NGO compared to the total amount pledged across all NGOs for the selected financial year.
Step 2: Determine the total Donation Matching amount that the corporate will be matching.
Step 3: Calculate the Matching amount by multiplying the percentage calculated in Step 1 for each NGO with the total Donation Matching amount.
Given the example:
NGO Name: Karma
       Employee Raised Funds for Karma(for the chosen financial year): ₹5,500
Total Pledge amount across all NGOs (Total of Employee Raised Funds column): ₹10,000
To calculate the percentage of Karma's pledge amount compared to the total amount:
     Percentage of Pledge Amount = (₹5,500 / ₹10,000) * 100
                                 = (5,500 / 10,000) * 100
                                 = 55%
Suppose the percentage of matching is 50%, and the Donation Matching amount is calculated as:
     Donation Matching = percentage of matching set by corporate* Total Pledge amount across all NGOs
	                                  = 50% * ₹10,000
                                      = ₹5,000
Now, the Matching amount for Karma:
     Matching amount = (Percentage for Karma NGO) * Donation Matching
                     = 55% * ₹5,000
                     = ₹2,750
Therefore, the Matching amount for Karma NGO is ₹2,750.

tasks.description:

Observations:
There is no clear ''legend'' to to distinguish the data sets ''Target value'' vs ''Impacted Number.''
The Bar graph is not interactive. Hovering over bars to view specific data values or clicking on bars does not show any specific values of the data set.
Solutions:
The Bar graph should have a clear ''legend".The legend should be positioned adjacent to the bar graph area for easy reference.
Each item in the legend should correspond to a distinct category or data series represented by the sections of the bars.
The legend items ''Target value" and ''Impacted value" should be visually connected to their corresponding sections of the bars, either through colour matching or pattern identification. This will help the user to identify each section of the bar without any confusion.
The Bar graph should be interactive and hovering over the different sections should indicate the values of the corresponding data sets.

The value of the Percentage has to be numeric only.

tasks.title: Verifying stop donation edge scenarios -time and date dependent
tasks.description:
Once the donation is stopped, there should be no deduction in the following month.
If the freeze date is greater than or equal to the stopped donation date, then the donation should not be deducted from the user's account. 
e.g., if the freeze date is the 25th of every month and a user stops donations on the 15th of any month because (25 >= 15), there won't be any deduction.
If the freeze date is less than the stopped donation date, then the donation should be deducted from the user's account.
e.g., if the freeze date is the 25th of every month and a user stops donations on the 26th, 27th, 28th, 29th, 30th, or 31st, then there will be a deduction. Starting in the next month, the deduction will stop.
We will continue mission updates for that mission even if donations are stopped. Those updates will be visible in the Updates section as well and an email will be triggered as per the original functionality

tasks.title: Dynamic Company Recommendations and Approval Restriction
tasks.description:
As an employee with corporate affiliation, I want to see if my company has recommended a specific mission, with dynamically displayed recommendation labels based on my employer profile, So that I can quickly identify missions that align with my company's interests, and ensure the number of recommendations is restricted to a maximum of five.

Note : This is applicable to Disaster Mission As well
UI Link - 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/a6493a5f-9b9f-48da-9008-c697e5b686eb-f31a/screen/12a97e3d-9873-4f25-bbc1-40a4dd8b5d29

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario 1: Viewing Recommended Missions
Given that I am an employee user logged into the platform with a corporate affiliation,
When I access a mission's details page,
Then I should see dynamic recommendation labels if my company has recommended the mission.
Scenario 2: Dynamic Recommendation Labels
As an employee user, I am viewing a mission's details page,
When my company has recommended the mission,
Then a recommendation label, “Recommended by <Corp Name>,"  associated with my company should be displayed, indicating the recommendation.
Scenario 3: Horizontal Scroll for Recommendations
Given that there are more than three recommendations for a mission,
When I view the mission's card on mission or disaster page,
Then I should see a horizontal scroll bar that allows me to view all recommendation missions.

Scenario 4: Metta Analyst's Approval Restriction
Given that I am an Metta Analyst and I am recommending missions to a Corp,
When I recommend more than five missions to the same Corp,
Then the system should restrict me from adding a sixth recommendation, prompting me to remove one of the existing ones.

Scenario 5: Discussion with NGO for Removal
Given that I am an approver and I need to remove a recommendation due to the five-mission limit,
When I am removing a recommendation,
Then I should follow the internal discussion process with the NGO to identify the recommendation that needs to be removed.

Scenario 6 : Excluded Clear Filter
Given that I am viewing the recommended mission list,
When I attempt to use the Clear Filter option,
Then the system should not respond, and the filters should remain unaffected.

Scenario 7: Excluded Location Filter
Given that I am viewing the recommended mission list,
When I try to modify the Location filter,
Then the system should prevent me from making any changes, ensuring the recommendations are not impacted by location preferences.

Scenario 8: Excluded Cause Category Filter
Given that I am on the recommended mission list,
When I attempt to adjust the Cause Category filter,
Then the system should not allow me to modify the filter settings, maintaining the focus on the recommendations.

Scenario 9: Explanatory Messaging
Given that I am viewing the recommended mission list,
When I interact with the excluded filters,
Then the system should provide an explanatory message indicating that filters are disabled for the recommended mission list.

Notes:
The dynamic recommendation labels provide users with quick insights into missions recommended by their affiliated companies.
The horizontal scroll bar enhances the user experience by accommodating multiple recommendation labels.
The approver's restriction ensures a maximum of five recommendations per corporation, promoting equitable distribution.
The internal discussion process with the NGO helps ensure informed and considered decisions when removing a recommendation.
Clear communication about the recommendation limit and the need for internal discussions should be emphasised among all relevant parties.

tasks.description:

Acceptance Criteria:
As a CORP Admin, when I am filling out the Settings: Two things should be taken care of.
Payroll Freeze Dates should have options  from 1 to 28 only.
If I select 26 as Freeze Date, and the Employee pledges on 26th at 18:00 hours(i.e. anytime of the day till 23:59), it should be considered in the current Payroll cycle - which would mean that once donations are successfully donated, this record also should be visible in Donation History.

tasks.title: DEMO - CORP Admin - Planned Donations logic
tasks.description:
Issue:
When a new  CORP Admin, sets the freeze date as 28th of every month in the Settings and the corresponding employee has made a PLEDGED on 29 or 30 or 31st of the same month. This record is not shown in PLANNED DONATIONS. As the logic used was a monthly cycle instead of PAYROLL FREEZE Cycle.

As a corporate administrator, I want the planned donation page to show data based on the corporation's freeze date, so that I can ensure that all donations are accurately recorded and processed. Additionally, I want the freeze date to be displayed on the planned donations page, so that I can easily reference it.

Acceptance Criteria:
When a corporate administrator navigates to the planned donations page, the page should display all planned donations that were made after the corporation's freeze date.
The freeze date should be displayed prominently on the planned donations page, in a clear and easy-to-read format. (Refer to Monthly Report Page) 
             Design Link:
          https://xd.adobe.com/view/8657132c-a639-4586-800b-e3481905cba0-d304/screen/71a94f68-72da-4b6c-8d43-239d4274f7d6/
If there are no planned donations made after the corporation's freeze date, the planned donations page should display a message indicating that there are no planned donations to display.
The planned donations page should not display any donations made on or before the corporation's freeze date.


As a new CORP Admin user, when the Payroll freeze date has passed and the CRON job is run, the Planned Donations (RECURRING/ONE-TIME) should show the next month's records.

Issue:
As a new CORP Admin user, I am unable to view next month's Planned Donations records even after the Payroll freeze date has passed and the CRON job is run. This creates confusion and delays in processing donations.

Acceptance Criteria:

The Planned Donations section should display the next month's records after the Payroll freeze date has passed and the CRON job is run.
The feature should only be available to CORP Admin users.
The feature should only display records for the upcoming month.
The feature should be disabled before the Payroll freeze date.
The feature should be enabled automatically after the Payroll freeze date.

Steps to Reproduce:
Log in to the CORP Admin account.
Check if the Payroll freeze date has passed.
Verify if the CRON job has been run.
Navigate to the Planned Donations section.
Check if the section displays next month's records.
Verify if the feature is disabled before the Payroll freeze date.
Verify if the feature is enabled automatically after the Payroll freeze date.

tasks.title: Employee: Signup form change
tasks.description:
As an employee interested in accessing the platform, I want a streamlined sign-up process where I can provide essential details such as Corporate Email ID, Password, Confirm Password, Employee ID,Mobile Number, First Name, and Last Name. So that I can trigger Keycloak integration for authentication and authorization, receive a verification email on my registered work email ID, complete the verification, and finally log in to explore my personalized corporate area on the platform.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario 1: Accessing Sign-Up Page
Given that I am an employee eager to join the platform,
When I navigate to the sign-up page,
Then I should find a well-designed form with fields for Corporate Email ID, Password, Confirm Password, Employee ID, Mobile Number, First Name, and Last Name.

Scenario 2: Providing Mandatory Information
Given that I am on the sign-up page,
When I enter all required information, including the corporate email ID, Password, Confirm Password, Employee ID, Mobile number, First Name, and Last Name,
Then the form should accept the input without errors.

Scenario 3: Submitting Sign-Up Form and Keycloak Integration
Given that I have filled in the necessary information,
When I submit the sign-up form,
Then the platform should trigger Keycloak integration for authentication and authorization using the provided Corporate Email ID and Password.

Scenario 4: Receiving Verification Email
Given that my Keycloak integration is successful,
When I check my registered work email ID,
Then I should receive a verification email containing a link to complete the verification process.

Scenario 5: Verifying Account
Given that I have received the verification email,
When I click on the verification link,
Then my account should be marked as verified, granting me access to the platform.

Scenario 6: Exploring Personalized Corporate Area
Given that my account is verified,
When I log in using my Corporate Email ID and Password,
Then I should be able to access my personalized corporate area on the platform, where I can explore the available features and content.

Scenario 7: Pre-Populating Corporate Employee Profile
Given that my Keycloak integration is successful,
When I access my corporate employee profile after verification,
Then I should find that all the details I provided during sign-up, including Corporate Email ID, Employee ID, Mobile Number, First and last name, and Last Name are automatically pre-populated into the respective fields.

Design Link: https://xd.adobe.com/view/7c36608c-0820-42d6-bbef-9a55523d73f5-2965/screen/b5c7a29e-1991-4258-88de-3451fbe654bc/

Urgency: Show missions with urgent needs, approaching deadlines, or time-sensitive goals at the top. This can create a sense of immediacy and encourage timely action.
Impact: Sort missions based on their potential impact. Projects with a higher number of beneficiaries or significant positive outcomes could be highlighted.
Diversity of Causes: Ensure a mix of different causes, so employees are exposed to a variety of philanthropic opportunities. This broadens their perspective on the types of issues they can support.
Customization: Allow employees to sort missions based on their own criteria, such as location, cause, or amount needed. Providing sorting filters empowers them to find missions that resonate with them.
Seasonal Relevance: Highlight missions that are relevant to current events or seasonal themes. For example, during holidays, showcase missions related to giving back or supporting communities.
Randomization: Introduce an element of surprise by occasionally displaying missions in a random order. This can capture attention and expose employees to missions they might not have considered otherwise.

tasks.title: Track Mission details whose donation has been stopped
tasks.description:
As an employee, I want to be able to track missions whose donations I have stopped, so that I can validate my contribution amount and maintain transparency with Mettasocial.

Acceptance Criteria:

The system should display a list of all missions where I have stopped my donations.
Each mission entry in the list should include relevant details such as the mission name, donation amount, and the date when I stopped the donation.
The list should provide an option to view further details of each mission, including the mission's purpose and progress.
The system should allow me to easily access my historical donation data for reference and validation.
Any changes in the mission status or updates to my donation information should be accurately reflected in the tracking feature.
The tracking functionality should be accessible through a user-friendly interface on the Mettasocial platform.
The system should ensure data security and confidentiality, protecting my personal information and donation history.
The feature should be responsive and usable across various devices and screen sizes.
The tracking feature should be well-documented, with clear instructions on how to use it effectively.
The system should provide appropriate error messages and handle any exceptional cases gracefully, ensuring a seamless user experience.

Note: The user story focuses on an employee's need to track missions where their donations have been stopped, emphasizing transparency and validation. The acceptance criteria outline specific requirements that the tracking feature should fulfill to meet the user's needs effectively.
