5.2 User Control Over Fetched Data from ZingHR(Update)
tasks.description:
As an employee whose details are fetched from "ZingHR", I want the ability to review and modify the information retrieved so that I can ensure the accuracy of my data and trust its security with us.

After the data is fetched using the connector, let the employee first verify their mobile number. 
Once the mobile number is verified, a save button should be enabled. Additionally, if an employee wants to override any details, they should have the ability to do so.

Note : All the mandatory fields can be changed but can not be blank

Acceptance criteria:
1) All the details should be fetched from ZingHR
2) The save button is enabled only when the mobile number is verified. This should happen only at the initial time
3) On clicking the save button, the system should check all the mandatory fields. Mandatory fields are Name, Email Address (Corporate), Phone Number,Address,Country,State City, and PAN Number
4) If mandatory fields are not filled, then user should not be able to save his or her profile
5) so in order to consider the completion of the profile, the user should go through following steps:
Mandatory fields should not be blank
Mobile number should be verified

If my LWD is after the freeze date, then deductions will happen for that month.

The field should be greyed out or disabled based on the connector setting
field should not be mandatory

tasks.title: 5.4 Streamlining Profile Data Entry for Employees
tasks.description:
As an employee using the "ZingHR" connector to fetch data, I want to seamlessly access my profile details without having to manually enter them, so that I can focus more on the primary intention, which is making donations. 

The below details should be automatically fetched from the ZingHR system. After every sign-up, these details should be fetched until the employee saves his or her details. 

Note: If the employee wants to override his or her details, that should also be possible. 

Email Address (Personal)
Phone Number*
Gender
Date of Birth (DOB)
Date of Joining (DOJ)
LWD
Business Unit
Address *
Country *
State *
City *
PAN Number *

Acceptance criteria:
1) All the details should be fetched from the zingHR system
2) Once the employee saves these details, they should have the ability to override them. For example, if I want to update my current address and prefer not to display my latest address, the employee should be able to make the necessary changes.
3) The system should check for permission from the corporate administrator to automatically fetch profile details
4) If permission is granted by the corporate administrator, the system should bypass manual entry of profile details for the employee
5) The system should provide a smooth user experience, minimizing interruptions and distractions for the employee.

tasks.title: Castler Fixes
tasks.description:

At times it happens that the Corporate did not send the money to this escrow account, because of which the job will fail.
We need to do an implementation that before running the job the system will check if the escrow account has the funds which should be more than or equal to the funds required to transfer it to all NGOs.
If the above condition is not met, then the job should not nor run.

tasks.title: Connection
tasks.description:

The textbox below the "Authentication Type" drop-down should be populated based on the selected option.
If the user chooses OAuth2.0 as the authentication type, the client ID, client secret, authorization URL, access token URL, and refresh token URL textboxes become mandatory.
The "Authentication Type" drop-down itself is mandatory.
Currently, only the Authentication Type = OAuth2.0 is available and greyed out; however, in the future, there will be multiple types on the "Authentication Type" screen.
Clicking the "Next" button should direct the user to the "Data Mapping" page.
Clicking the "Back" button should navigate the user to the "Requirement Selection" page.
Clicking the "Save" button allows the user to save the data.
If no changes are detected, the "Save" button should be disabled, and the "Next" button should be visible.
If changes are observed, the save button should be enabled first, and then the "Next" button should be enabled after saving the changes.
In the absence of changes, an information message should be visible, stating "No Changes are Observed."

tasks.title: Replacing Sendgrid With Zoho for Email Configuration
tasks.description:
We want to replace Sendgrid with Zoho for sending emails to our customers so that we can improve our email communication process and close our Sendgrid account. We want to utilize the existing credits in Zoho instead of making payments to SendGrid.

Acceptance Criteria:

Zoho's email services have been set up and configured to replace SendGrid for sending transactional and marketing emails.
All existing email templates and content from SendGrid have been migrated to Zoho.
The SMTP configurations for applications and systems that send emails have been updated to point to Zoho's SMTP servers.
The Zoho email system has been thoroughly tested to ensure it functions correctly and reliably for SMTP email delivery.
Any necessary DNS records, such as DKIM and SPF, have been updated to reflect the change to Zoho as the email service provider.
A plan for managing and segmenting customer email lists within Zoho has been established.
All relevant team members have been trained on how to use Zoho for email communications, including the updated SMTP settings.
A thorough review of Zoho's deliverability and security features has been conducted to ensure they meet our requirements.
The SendGrid account has been closed, and any associated billing has been discontinued.

Definition of Done:
SendGrid has been successfully replaced with Zoho for sending emails to our customers.
All email communication, including transactional and marketing emails, is functioning properly through Zoho with updated SMTP configurations.
The team is confident in the reliability and performance of Zoho's email services and SMTP server.
All necessary DNS and email authentication configurations, including SMTP, have been updated and verified.
Team members are proficient in using Zoho for email communications with the updated SMTP settings.
A clear process for managing email lists and campaigns is in place.
The SendGrid account has been closed, and no further billing or usage is occurring through SendGrid.

tasks.title: Custom Sign-In Page with Keycloak Verification
tasks.description:
As a NGO user,I want to access a custom sign-in page that incorporates Keycloak verification,
So that I can securely log in to my account and benefit from the added layer of authentication provided by Keycloak.

Acceptance Criteria:

The platform should offer a customized sign-in page with a user-friendly interface.
The sign-in page should integrate seamlessly with Keycloak's authentication mechanism.
When attempting to log in, I should be redirected to the custom sign-in page.
After I provide my credentials, the Keycloak integration should verify the authenticity of my login details.
Upon successful verification, I should be granted access to my account based on the role assigned to me.

Notes:
The custom sign-in page enhances the user experience by providing a branded and familiar environment for login.
The integration with Keycloak ensures robust security and authentication.
Successful verification should lead to a smooth login experience for users.

tasks.title: All Modules : Introducing Login Report for Superadmin Across all the Modules
tasks.description:
As a Superadmin, I need to track and monitor login activities across all the modules(NGO, Metta Analyst, Corp). This involves creating a login report that displays information about user logins, including their name, email, date, time, frequency of login, IP address, and geographical location. 

Acceptance criteria:
User Access Level - Only the Super admin should be able to  access the "Login Reports" section.
Display the Report - The report displays user name, email, date, time, login frequency, IP address, and location. Entries should be sorted in a descending order of user has logged in
Pagination - Pagination should be implemented for multiple entries
Search(Optional) - Search functionality should be implemented allowing user to search for any entry.
Export(Optional) : An export feature that allows users to export the login report data to a downloadable format like CSV or Excel should be implemented.

Note : For every module only super admin will have access to login report screen.

tasks.title: Metta Analyst -  Document Download Tracking for Metta Analyst Superadmin
tasks.description:
As a Metta Analyst superadmin, I require the ability to track and monitor all documents downloaded from the Metta Analyst (MA) platform by other users. This functionality will enable efficient tracking and analysis of user activities.
Acceptance Criteria:
Document Tracking Screen:
The MA superadmin should have access to an exclusive screen designed for tracking downloaded documents.
Information Display:
The tracking screen should display the following information for each downloaded document:
User Name: The name of the user who downloaded the document.
Document Name: The name of the downloaded document.
Date and Timestamp: The exact date and time when the document was downloaded.
User Location: The location of the user at the time of document download. For eg, Pune, Maharashtra.
Access Control:
Only the MA superadmin should have access to this tracking screen. Other users or roles should not be able to view this information.
Tabular Format:
The downloaded document entries should be presented in a tabular format.
Columns for user name, document name, date/timestamp, and user location should be clearly visible in the table.
Sorting by Date:
The document entries should be sorted in descending order based on the date and timestamp, with the most recent entry appearing at the top of the table.
Pagination:
Implement pagination to accommodate multiple entries. A reasonable number of entries should be displayed per page.
Search and Filtering (Optional):
Consider adding search and filtering options to allow the MA superadmin to quickly locate specific documents or users.
Implement search by document name.
Export Option (Optional):
Consider providing an option to export the tracking data for further analysis, such as in CSV or Excel format.

tasks.title: Metta Analyst- See CORP Name for Conditional Approved Projects/Missions
tasks.description:
Acceptance Criteria:

The Corp name should be visible for conditional approved Missions and Projects in both the list page and details page.
The Corp name should be clearly labeled and easily distinguishable from other information.
Metta Analysts should be able to see the Corp name for all conditional approved Missions and Projects.
Steps to Reproduce:

Log in as a Metta Analyst.
Navigate to the Missions or Projects list page.
Check if there are any conditional approved Missions or Projects.
Verify that the Corp name is visible for each conditional approved Mission or Project.
Click on a conditional approved Mission or Project to view its details page.
Verify that the Corp name is visible on the details page, along with other relevant information.
Repeat steps 3-6 for multiple conditional approved Missions or Projects to ensure consistency.
Verify that the Corp name is clearly labeled and easily distinguishable from other information on both the list page and details page.

tasks.title: Metta Analyst - View Draft Missions
tasks.description:
Acceptance Criteria:

Metta Analysts should have access to the Missions tab.
Draft Missions should be visible to Metta Analysts in the Missions tab.
Metta Analysts should be able to view all details of Draft Missions.
Steps to Reproduce:

Verify that all details of the Draft Mission are visible, including its objectives, target audience, and expected outcomes.

tasks.title: Metta Analyst - Filtered Result Accuracy and Count Matching for Metta Analyst
tasks.description:
As a Metta Analyst I should be able to apply necessary filter(s) as per my wish so that I can the see desired result according to my selection(s).

Acceptance criteria:
MA should be able to see the selected NGO Status in the result shown.
For example, if I'm searching with NGO Status "L0 Approved" I should be able to see the NGO who are L0 Approved, with their status to be shown in the result table as "L0 Approved" strictly. Basically, the value in the NGO status Multiselect should be the same value shown in the result table column "NGO STATUS" even if it has multiple statuses.


The result data shown should be the result of AND operation applied on each filter that has been selected by Metta Analyst.
In the ss shown below, the defect in the current system can be seen. Even if I have applied filter for "Poverty" Secondary Cause. I can see Ngo with Secondary cause as "Malnutrition".
This should be handled properly with result shown to be the result of AND operation of all the filters selected by MA.


The Count of the result shown i.e the NGO status that I have selected in the filter, should match with the count shown in the NGO page.

tasks.title: Corp - Checking for Duplicate CIN
tasks.description:
As an Corp Employee, I want to be able to see an error message when I enter a duplicate CIN in the respective field, which is already present in our system,
So that I can avoid duplication and maintain accurate records.
Acceptance Criteria:
The error message should appear immediately after the user enters a duplicate CIN and disappear once a unique CIN is entered or the duplicate is resolved.
The system should prevent the form from being submitted or proceed further until a unique CIN is entered or the duplicate is resolved.

tasks.title: NGO - Checking for duplicate Registration Number
tasks.description:

So that I can avoid duplication and maintain accurate records.
Acceptance Criteria:
The error message should appear immediately after the user enters a duplicate registration number and disappear once a unique registration number is entered or the duplicate is resolved.
The system should prevent the form from being submitted or proceed further until a unique registration number is entered or the duplicate is resolved.

tasks.title: Reject Proposal Modification Request by NGO
tasks.description:
As an NGO, I should have the facility to reject or drop the proposal modification request suggested by the corporate so that I can find another corporate for a better funding option.

When an NGO receives a proposal modification request via email notification, they will have the option to approve or reject the proposal. If a NGO reject a proposal modification request, in that case it will be considered as 'proposal request dropped by NGO'

Triggered point from Email Template - 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/19ac2f03-bcbe-4635-829c-46c8bb269c46-4cff/screen/018ac73d-1d92-4a4e-8f7c-55471c133ed9/

When the user clicks on drop request, an OTP window should appear and ask for confirmation. Once the request is dropped, a proposal should moved to All Proposals ➝ Set Proposal Status = 'Awaiting Funds' ➝ Unmasked ➝ Dropped

Note : Comment section in the OTP screens are mandatory which will be considered as Dropped Reason

https://xd.adobe.com/view/03e9e302-4a93-49b3-b5c5-f96ea086d941-56ba/screen/cf9d8308-7286-457c-8204-a6d0e1a70397/

tasks.title: More Segmented Control for Unmasked Proposal
tasks.description:
As a corporate user, I should be able to see more segmentation under the "unmasked" proposal so that I can see a list of proposal under a appropriate status.

A user will select 'Awaiting funds' as their overall status. A "waiting funds" status should be followed by a "proposal request," "masked," or "unmasked" status.

When corporate is filtering projects based on their status as workflow initiated, ongoing projects, or funded projects, in that case, it should route to Unmasked segmented control by default.

When the user is searching for projects based on project status as 'Awaiting Funds', in that case, the user should route to Masked Segmented Control by default.


A 'Unmasked' status should be followed by a "Approved","Requested Modification" or "Dropped" status

Approved: All the proposal & their counts whose 'Requested Modification' has been approved 
Requested Modification - A count and list of the proposal whose modification request(Change in Beneficiary Number & Requested Funding Amount) has been sent by corporate
Dropped - A count and list of the proposal whose modification request is dropped by NGO

UI Link - 
https://xd.adobe.com/view/03e9e302-4a93-49b3-b5c5-f96ea086d941-56ba/screen/e465160a-65fb-4082-864f-c47ea8f934e4/

Metta analyst Dashboard - Finance
tasks.description:
As a metta analyst manager, I should have access to the finance dashboard in order to see the overall distribution of allocated and disbursed funds.

Link : https://xd.adobe.com/view/95398177-90a3-4885-baae-0a3f74a50841-c06a/screen/45816145-5ba2-4a96-a0de-3710e62b501d/

Funds Allocated vs. Disbursed: This is the total or sum of all the campaign allocated funds that are approved vs. the total amount of disbursed funds.

Top-Funded NGO’s: Display the top 5 NGOs based on the funding amount. It should also display the number of the campaign and the funding amount.

Funds mobilized (current vs. last year): Display the top 5 NGOs based on the amount of funds mobilized (consumed). It should display Current_Year-1 and Current_Year-2.

Donation From Region: highlight the state/district/city from which a donation has been received, along with the cumulative amount, number of NGOs, and district.

Donation for Region (Program Implementation): highlight the state, district, or city for which a donation has been received,along with the cumulative amount, number of NGOs, and district.

Top Corporates by Funds Donated: The top five corporations that donated funds are listed in descending order. A filter option should be available based on the types of campaigns, like direct and community.

Funds Raised: Funds raised till now from metta social platform A filter option should be available based on the monthly, quarterly, and yearly data.

NOTE : add and remove widget option should be available.

tasks.title: Metta Analyst Dashboard - Proposal
tasks.description:
As a Metta analyst manager, I should have the facility to observe the project proposal overview for all the NGOs from the central location so that I can take a decision or refer the well-curated campaign to corporate.

Link : https://xd.adobe.com/view/95398177-90a3-4885-baae-0a3f74a50841-c06a/screen/c0cce287-082d-4e17-87e4-8106286b0bde/

Total Project Proposals Received on the Metta Social Platform: Number of project proposals or campaigns onboarded on the platform, along with their status.

Project Proposal/Campaign Requests: It should display all the statuses that required action from the Metta analyst, along with their counts.

Campaign Types: The total number or count of project proposals depends on the type of project proposal/campaign.

Total Proposals Approved: The total number of proposals approved by Metta analysts is based on the filter selected by the user on the dashboard. It could be monthly, Quarterly or Yearly

Top Funded Projects: The top 7 funded projects approved via the Metta social platform till date.

Active Proposals by Funds Required: The Top 7 Proposals That Required Funding Along with NGO.
Campaigns by Cause Category: 
All the available/existing campaign/project proposals by cause category (primary, secondary, and SDG) should be displayed along with the number of campaigns/project proposals. Upon clicking on the SDG  bubble, the cause category distribution should also be visible in percentage format.
Filter criteria : Based on SDG , Primary Causes, Secondary Causes ( similar hierarchy)

Projects by Location:
display the project location on the map. Upon clicking on the highlighted area, all the available campaigns or project locations are displayed across all the statuses along with their counts.

Campaigns by Beneficiary Type: 
Display the bubble chart available on the platform w.r.t. beneficiary type and its count.

Proposals by Project Locations:
Count of proposals based on the project location. Example: If the user selects Pune as the project location, in that case, it should display the total count of proposals implemented in Pune as the project location.

Total Proposals Approved:
A area chart should display the number of campaigns submitted and approved across all months of the year.

tasks.title: L1 - feature in SocioNXT
tasks.description:
Hi Team,

As discussed in the 11th Jan - Weekly Collaboration meeting, I'm sharing the documents for your reference. 

1. SOP for L1 Due Diligence (This is a working document) - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1g5itg2oFS7jAeJmnbnfyq2OFQz-mNn9KVJc71J5ZyWg/edit

2. Report Template for Overall Due Diligence - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xrBjtgULioXbtLuSAqEfMnfsySHKRlGeQpOcWaCBPw8/edit

The functionality for adding and deleting the questions is essential, as over time we will have modifications etc. 

Secondly, the moderator feature within L1 and the rating scale are also very important. 

Thirdly, once the NGO has responded to a query during interaction (virtual meeting), at the moment we do a meeting with them and then again want to update a SocioNXT, how can we gather a history of this? Right now, when the NGO modifies its information on SocioNXT, we are not able to see it. We only get to see "Modified" in green on a certain sections. 

Please let us know if you have any questions.

This message is an extension to the email sent to Sachin on 16th Jan. Putting it her as suggested by Sachin. 

The deadline suggested was 15th Feb.

Best,
Jaya

3. The scrolling screen seems to be very small, can something be done?

Regards,
Jaya
